sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: Jefferies raises Olema Pharmaceuticals stock price target to $43 on SERD validation
feed.summary: Jefferies has increased its price target for Olema Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:OLMA) to $43.00 from $30.00, maintaining a Buy rating. This adjustment follows positive Phase 3 trial data for Roche’s giredestrant, which validates the oral selective estrogen receptor degrader (SERD) drug class, including Olema’s palazestrant. The firm anticipates a significant opportunity for this drug class and has raised the probability of success for Olema's palazestrant in first-line HR+ metastatic breast cancer.

feed.title: |‘Iron Chef,’ ‘Forensic Files’ Among FAST Channels in Radial-Telus Canada Deal (EXCLUSIVE)
feed.summary: |Radial Entertainment has secured a licensing agreement with Telus Communications to bring five fan-favorite FAST channels, including "Iron Chef" and "Forensic Files," to Telus's streaming platforms in Canada. The deal makes over 910 hours of content available on Telus TV and Stream+, accessible to Optik TV and Stream+ subscribers at no extra cost. This partnership aims to leverage Radial's FAST expertise and deliver premium content to a broad Canadian audience.

feed.title: HII Hosts Australian Delegation at Newport News Shipbuilding
feed.summary: HII hosted an Australian delegation led by Deputy Prime Minister Richard Marles at its Newport News Shipbuilding division, supporting the AUKUS partnership. The visit highlighted HII's commitment to providing Australia with nuclear-powered submarines and advancing related capabilities, including the Australian Submarine Supplier Qualification (AUSSQ) program. The delegation toured facilities, learned about workforce development, and attended the keel-laying ceremony for the Virginia-class submarine Barb (SSN 804).

feed.title: Copart Inc. Stock Underperforms Wednesday When Compared To Competitors Despite Daily Gains
feed.summary: Copart Inc. (CPRT) stock underperformed its competitors on Wednesday, despite daily gains, with a 1.14% drop. The article also briefly mentions Unity Software's (U.US) fourth-quarter earnings, where revenue increased 35% year-over-year to $609 million, exceeding estimates, though the company reported a quarterly loss of 66 cents per share.

feed.title: Invesco stock hits 52-week high at 27.3 USD
feed.summary: Invesco (IVZ) has reached a new 52-week high at $27.3 USD, reflecting robust investor confidence and a significant 52.75% increase over the past year. The asset management firm, with a market capitalization of $12.12 billion, also maintains a 3.12% dividend yield, though InvestingPro suggests it might be slightly overvalued. Recent activities include a slight decrease in AUM, a strategic partnership with LGT Capital Partners, and analyst target increases from BMO Capital and TD Cowen.

feed.title: Duke Energy Foundation (NYSE: DUK) commits $500K via 20 NC nonprofits to aid small firms
feed.summary: The Duke Energy Foundation announced it will provide $500,000 in grants to support North Carolina small businesses. Twenty nonprofit organizations will each receive $25,000 to distribute awards of up to $5,000 to individual businesses for various needs such as renovations, equipment, or inventory. This initiative builds on the Foundation's prior small business support, which has totaled over $2.4 million since 2020.

feed.title: SLB, Shell partner to accelerate digital and AI solutions in upstream operations
feed.summary: SLB and Shell have signed a strategic collaboration agreement to co-develop new digital and AI technologies to enhance performance and efficiency in upstream operations. This initiative will focus on creating agentic AI solutions and building an open data and AI infrastructure using SLB’s Lumi™ platform to support real-time decision-making and automate workflows. The partnership aims to deliver measurable performance gains, reduce operational costs, and accelerate the adoption of advanced digital solutions across the industry.

feed.title: PayPal downgraded by BofA as branded checkout turnaround stalls
feed.summary: Bank of America has downgraded PayPal (NASDAQ:PYPL) to "Neutral" due to the slower-than-expected turnaround in its core branded checkout business and anticipated heavy investments in 2026. Analysts are awaiting clearer evidence of the company's turnaround gaining traction before recommending a stronger position. The brokerage also noted PayPal's concerns about macro pressures affecting holiday spending, contrasting with generally positive reports from other retailers.

feed.title: Ameriprise (NYSE: AMP) adds four advisors with nearly $300M, Kuttin team tops $14B
feed.summary: Ameriprise Financial recently welcomed four experienced financial advisors managing collectively nearly $300 million in client assets, joining Kuttin Wealth Management. This move allows the advisors, including Kevin Kitt from UBS Financial Services, to leverage Ameriprise's and Kuttin Wealth Management's resources for growth and an enhanced client experience. Kuttin Wealth Management, which oversees over $14 billion in client assets, continues to expand its team across the country.

feed.title: Assessing J. M. Smucker’s Valuation After Pausing a Coffee Price Hike to Absorb Tariff Costs
feed.summary: J. M. Smucker (SJM) has decided against a third coffee price hike this year, opting to absorb $75 million in tariff-related costs instead, following a period of declining shareholder returns. Despite a recent share price drop, a popular narrative suggests the company is 14.2% undervalued, anticipating improved profitability and stable growth, though risks like commodity volatility and slower sales could challenge this outlook. Simply Wall St's DCF model presents an even more optimistic valuation, suggesting the stock is 54% undervalued.

feed.title: What’s Next For Air Products Stock?
feed.summary: Air Products & Chemicals (NYSE: APD) experienced a nearly 25% stock decline in 2025, largely due to a strategic reset involving the exit from several capital-heavy clean energy projects, resulting in a $2.3 billion charge. This, combined with underlying business challenges like weak volume trends and macroeconomic pressures, and leadership changes, created significant investor uncertainty. Despite these issues and a muted growth outlook, APD maintains healthy cash flows and a stable dividend, suggesting a potential recovery reliant on restored margin growth and a clearer, more cautious strategy.

feed.title: NXP is putting its longtime US HQ on market in Austin
feed.summary: NXP Semiconductors N.V. is selling its 155-acre Oak Hill campus in Austin, which served as its U.S. headquarters, as it searches for new office space. This move coincides with the closure of an Arizona plant and a number of local employee layoffs. The company's long-term presence in Austin is undergoing significant changes.

feed.title: Inside Raymond James' plan to get an edge with AI
feed.summary: Raymond James is aggressively pursuing artificial intelligence (AI) to gain a competitive edge, emphasizing its potential as a "huge differentiator" with full advisor buy-in. The firm has launched AI products, embedded machine learning tools, and appointed dedicated executives for AI initiatives. They have committed nearly $1 billion of their annual budget to technology, highlighting their significant investment in this area.

feed.title: Gas explosion in San Francisco Bay Area damages homes, sends heavy smoke into air
feed.summary: A gas explosion in a San Francisco Bay Area neighborhood caused a significant fire, damaging several homes and sending heavy smoke into the air. The incident, which occurred in Hayward, resulted from a construction crew damaging an underground gas line. Pacific Gas & Electric Co. confirmed that its workers were not involved, and the gas flow was stopped approximately two hours after the line was damaged.

feed.title: Teva (NYSE:TEVA) Valuation Check After New Schizophrenia Drug Filing and Growing Growth Optimism
feed.summary: Teva Pharmaceutical Industries (TEVA) has filed for FDA approval of a new once-monthly schizophrenia injectable, adding to its recent positive momentum. While the stock has seen significant gains and is attracting investor interest, Simply Wall St's analysis suggests Teva is currently overvalued based on a narrative fair value of $28.60, despite trading at a steep discount to some intrinsic value models. The company's future hinges on biosimilar growth and margin improvement, but risks like execution missteps and pricing pressures could challenge this outlook.

feed.title: AvalonBay Communities (AVB): Revisiting Valuation After Asset Sales Plan and Aggressive 2025 Buybacks
feed.summary: AvalonBay Communities (AVB) has announced plans to sell three apartment communities and has been actively buying back its stock in 2025. Despite a recent share price decline year-to-date, the company's valuation narrative suggests it is 13.5% undervalued, with a fair value estimated at $203.79, driven by expected low new multifamily supply in its core markets. This comes after a tough period, but long-term shareholders are still seeing positive returns.

feed.title: Lost Investment in The Home Depot, Inc. (HD)? Levi & Korsinsky Launches Securities Fraud Investigation
feed.summary: Levi & Korsinsky has initiated a securities fraud investigation into The Home Depot, Inc. (HD) following a drop in its stock price. The investigation stems from The Home Depot's announcement of third-quarter fiscal results and updated 2025 guidance, where the CEO disclosed that results missed expectations due to lower-than-anticipated demand, leading to a more than 6% stock price decrease on November 18, 2025. The firm aims to determine if federal securities laws were violated.

feed.title: ITC Infotech (PTC) receives FY25 PTC Partner Network Award in global PLM category
feed.summary: ITC Infotech has been awarded the PTC Partner Network Award for FY25 in the Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) category, recognizing its strong expertise, innovation, and commitment to customer value. This global award highlights ITC Infotech's leadership in PLM-led digital transformation and its strategic collaboration with PTC to drive innovation and accelerate digital transformation for customers. The company's DxP Services have been instrumental in helping enterprises modernize product development lifecycles and build intelligent solutions.

feed.title: American International Group: Fairly Valued Even If Chubb M&A Rumors Don't Materialize
feed.summary: Shares of American International Group (AIG) have performed strongly, partly due to rumors of an M&A bid from Chubb, which validates AIG's turnaround. While AIG's underwriting has improved with strong Q3 results and multi-year low combined ratios, regulatory hurdles make a deal unlikely, and further margin expansion appears challenging. Despite ongoing buybacks and a 2.2% yield, AIG is considered fairly valued with limited near-term upside, offering market-like returns without a clear catalyst.

feed.title: Guarantor: JPMorgan Chase & Co.
feed.summary: This SEC filing details JPMorgan Chase Financial Company LLC's $1,839,000 Review Notes, guaranteed by JPMorgan Chase & Co., linked to the MerQube US Tech+ Vol Advantage Index and due December 14, 2032. The notes are designed for investors seeking early exit at a premium if the index hits a Call Value. Key risks include potential principal loss, a 6.0% per annum daily deduction on the index, and credit risks of both JPMorgan Financial and JPMorgan Chase & Co.

feed.title: Brand Engagement Network Inc Forms Skye Salud to Modernize Mexican Healthcare
feed.summary: Brand Engagement Network Inc. (BNAI) announced the formation of Skye Salud on December 11, 2025, with the aim of modernizing healthcare in Mexico. Skye Salud will deploy Mexico's first nationwide AI platform through a partnership with KNOBLOCH, focusing on enhancing patient safety and expanding care access. Initial pilot programs are scheduled for Q1 2026 in public hospitals, and BEN will receive 35% of gross revenues from Skye Inteligencia LATAM.

feed.title: How Dow’s US$3 Billion Infrastructure Stake Sale At Dow (DOW) Has Changed Its Investment Story
feed.summary: Dow Inc. recently sold a 49% stake in its U.S. Gulf Coast infrastructure assets for US$3 billion, a move that reinforces its focus on strengthening the balance sheet and improving cash flow. This sale, coupled with tighter capital expenditure and gains in its Industrial Intermediates & Infrastructure segment, aims to offset weak demand and margin pressure. The company's future investment story hinges on its efficiency in cost cutting, energy management, and reinvesting liquidity without compromising long-term growth.

feed.title: Newsweek names Armstrong World Industries one of U.S.’s Greenest Companies
feed.summary: Newsweek has recognized Lancaster-based Armstrong World Industries as one of America’s Greenest Companies for the second consecutive year. The company is committed to sustainability through initiatives like energy-saving ceilings and low embodied carbon panels, aiming to reduce operational and material-related carbon in buildings. Armstrong's 2025 Sustainability Report details progress in healthy products, planet, and communities, including reducing chemical use and expanding eco-friendly product lines.

feed.title: Raymond James Partners With Bank Midwest To Support $692 Million Wealth Program Transition
feed.summary: Raymond James has significantly expanded its Financial Institutions Division by partnering with Bank Midwest, integrating Bank Midwest's investment program with $692 million in client assets. This alliance enables Bank Midwest's Midwest Wealth Management to rebrand as Midwest Wealth Group, offering enhanced wealth management services through Raymond James Financial Services, aiming to strengthen client service and provide access to broader resources. Both companies emphasize improved efficiency, an elevated client experience, and long-term growth opportunities from this strategic relationship.

feed.title: Iron Mountain: Double-digit growth continues, fueled by data center and ALM expansion, with robust financial discipline
feed.summary: Iron Mountain maintains double-digit growth driven by its Matterhorn strategy, with no further restructuring planned. The company's data center and ALM businesses are expanding rapidly due to strong leasing, rising memory prices, and strategic acquisitions. Capital is primarily focused on high-return data center projects, while digital and physical storage remain robust.

feed.title: T1 Energy Inc: Growth or Bubble?
feed.summary: T1 Energy Inc. (NYSE: TE) stocks are down 11.3% due to investor concerns over regulatory changes, despite a previous 9% surge and substantial growth in renewable energy due to market demand and innovation. The company's financial landscape shows $2.94M in revenue and a $96.77B market valuation, but also a high debt-to-equity ratio of 2.7 and a negative EBIT margin of -39.9%. The article explores whether TE's rapid growth is sustainable or indicative of a market bubble, driven by green technology demand and strategic market positioning.

feed.title: Consumers Energy (NYSE: CMS) defends 100 MW data center tariff as key customer safeguard
feed.summary: Consumers Energy is defending its 100 MW data center tariff and customer safeguards against a legal challenge from Michigan's Attorney General. The company states the MPSC order establishes guidelines for energy-intensive businesses, ensuring they pay their full cost of service and contribute to fixed system costs, benefiting all nearly 2 million Michigan customers. Consumers Energy emphasizes that this framework supports responsible economic growth and plans to update its energy supply to meet projected growth.

feed.title: Arista Networks Unveils New Products To Boost AI Use Cases
feed.summary: Arista Networks is launching new and updated products across its networking, AI, and ruggedized platforms by Q1 2026. These innovations leverage AI principles through Arista's Eos, NetDL, and Ava to simplify network management and address vendor silos. The company also introduced new ruggedized platforms for industrial use and reported strong revenue growth, despite facing component shortages.

feed.title: Huntington Ingalls Industries stock hits all-time high at 330.0 USD
feed.summary: Huntington Ingalls Industries (HII) stock has reached a new all-time high of $330.0 USD, marking a significant 72.55% increase over the last year. This milestone reflects strong investor confidence and the company's consistent growth in the defense and shipbuilding industry, supported by recent strategic initiatives and contract wins.

feed.title: How a Greenville turbine factory earned a White House shout out
feed.summary: A Greenville factory operated by GE Vernova, a General Electric spinoff, received a White House shout out for its role in a $14.2 billion deal to ship gas-fired turbines to Saudi Arabia. This deal was part of a larger $1 trillion investment commitment from Saudi Arabia touted by the Trump administration. While the recognition highlighted GE Vernova's significant contributions to energy demand and job creation, the impressive figures did not represent new promises for South Carolina but rather reaffirmed existing investments, including a substantial $160 million for the Greenville facility and plans to hire 650 new workers.

feed.title: Strategy Fights MSCI Proposal to Remove Digital Asset Treasury Companies
feed.summary: Strategy Inc. is challenging MSCI's proposal to remove digital asset treasury companies (DATs) from its global indexes, arguing that the 50% threshold for digital assets is arbitrary and discriminatory. The company warns that this exclusion could lead to billions in passive fund sell-offs, despite Strategy's assertion that it operates as a legitimate business leveraging Bitcoin for shareholder returns. Strategy maintains that it uses its Bitcoin holdings for innovative digital credit instruments and enterprise analytics software, not merely as an investment fund.

feed.title: Globe Life (GL) Stock Trades Up, Here Is Why
feed.summary: Shares of Globe Life (GL) rose 2.7% after TD Cowen increased its price target to $199 and maintained a "Buy" rating, adding the stock to its "Best Ideas 2026" list due to its attractive and scalable business model. The company's stock has shown strong performance this year, up 23.7%, and is trading near its 52-week high, with a significant gain for long-term investors. This follows a positive second-quarter earnings report five months prior, where Globe Life beat EPS estimates and raised its full-year profit forecast.

feed.title: Citigroup (C) Valuation Check After New Preferred Stock, Strong Results and Upbeat 2025 Income Outlook
feed.summary: Citigroup (C) has seen significant positive developments including a new preferred stock series, strong financial results, and an optimistic 2025 net interest income outlook. Despite a substantial share price rally exceeding 160% over three years, analysts like ChadWisperer suggest the stock remains undervalued, with a fair value potentially doubling its current price due to projected growth in platforms like Citi Token Services and Investment Banking. However, investors should consider execution and regulatory risks associated with digital asset adoption and potential capital rule changes.

feed.title: Abbott's Billion-Dollar Threat: Pull the Plug or Get a Bailout?
feed.summary: Abbott Laboratories is facing significant legal and financial pressure due to a wave of lawsuits linking its Similac preemie formula to necrotizing enterocolitis (NEC), with a jury ordering a $500 million payout in one case. The company is actively lobbying Congress for legislation that could mitigate its legal exposure, even threatening to pull its preemie products from the market if no action is taken. This situation has created a complex scenario involving legal battles, lobbying efforts, and supply chain concerns, with potential industry-wide settlements estimated at up to $4 billion.

feed.title: OCC flags Bank of America, Wells Fargo and other big banks for 'debanking' certain industries
feed.summary: A federal banking regulator has released preliminary findings indicating that Bank of America and eight other major national banks restricted financial services to customers in certain industries between 2020 and 2023. This "debanking" practice has put these financial institutions under renewed scrutiny. The Charlotte Business Journal covered this review as it pertains to Bank of America and Wells Fargo.

feed.title: AdvaMed Names Resmed CEO Mick Farrell as Next Board Chair
feed.summary: AdvaMed has announced that Resmed Chairman and CEO Michael "Mick" Farrell will serve a two-year term as its board chairman, beginning in January 2026. Farrell, a long-standing member of AdvaMed's board, expressed honor in his new role, emphasizing patient focus and innovation. He succeeds Peter Arduini of GE HealthCare, under whose tenure AdvaMed saw significant growth and integration of new divisions.

feed.title: New study from HFS Research and NewRocket finds that implementation partners can help maximize ServiceNow's AI-first operating model
feed.summary: A new study by HFS Research and NewRocket indicates that implementation partners are crucial for maximizing ServiceNow's AI-first operating model. The report highlights that successful ServiceNow implementations are linked to an AI strategy, with a significant number of executives willing to switch providers for AI strategy and implementation specialists. Enterprises embracing agentic AI can unlock ServiceNow's full potential by shifting to results-based delivery and engineering trust into operations.

feed.title: TELUS (TSE:T) Shares Fall to One-Year Low on High Leverage Concerns
feed.summary: TELUS (TSE:T) shares have fallen to a one-year low, attributed to concerns over high leverage, modest margins, and mixed evaluations within Canada's telecommunications market. The company offers mobile, internet, television, and landline services, primarily in Western Canada, and is a significant player among Canadian telecom providers. Key financial metrics such as leverage ratios, net margin, and liquidity are critical indicators of its operational structure and performance.

feed.title: International Value has Outshone US Growth
feed.summary: Since generative AI's 2022 debut, international developed markets (EAFE) have seen value outperform growth, notably led by banks, while the U.S. and emerging markets have favored growth. A 50/50 blend of the MSCI USA Growth and MSCI EAFE Value Indexes has historically provided diversification benefits, higher returns, and lower volatility, particularly in rising interest rate environments. This suggests a need for regionally aware style allocation for resilient portfolios.

feed.title: A letter from a member to the SFA RE Barclays PLC
feed.summary: A member of the Scottish Football Supporters Association (SFSA) has written to the SFA to express deep concern over its sponsorship agreement with Barclays PLC, which includes naming Hampden Park as ‘Barclays Hampden’. The member argues that Barclays is complicit in facilitating the conflict in Gaza and illegal Israeli settlements by investing in companies supplying weapons and military technology to Israel. The letter urges the SFA to withdraw from the deal due to moral implications and potential public relations disaster, calling for solidarity with Scottish values.

feed.title: Guggenheim initiates coverage of Amazon.com (AMZN) with "Buy" rating and $300 price target
feed.summary: Guggenheim has initiated coverage of Amazon.com (AMZN) with a "Buy" rating, reflecting a positive outlook on the company's future performance. The firm set a price target of $300 for AMZN, suggesting significant potential upside for the stock. This new analyst coverage could influence investor sentiment and trading activity for Amazon shares.

feed.title: $150M Public-Private Amphitheater Project Planned In Webster
feed.summary: Venu Holding Corp. plans to construct a $150M public-private amphitheater, named Sunset Amphitheater Houston at Webster, in a partnership with the city of Webster and the Webster Economic Development Corp. The 12,500-capacity venue will be located in Webster’s Flyway development, a mixed-use entertainment and tourism area, and will feature year-round live entertainment amenities including the Aikman Club and Luxe FireSuites. This project is part of significant regional growth, with other major developments also underway in the area.

feed.title: Ngai-Pesic buys Silvaco Group shares worth $103k
feed.summary: Katherine S. Ngai-Pesic, a director and 10% owner at Silvaco Group, Inc. (NASDAQ:SVCO), purchased 25,000 shares of common stock for $103,305 on December 10, 2025. This transaction increased her direct holdings to 10,303,886 shares. The acquisition follows Silvaco's reported record Q3 2025 revenue, a restructuring plan, and analyst ratings, with Rosenblatt lowering its price target to $9.00 while Needham reiterated a Buy rating at $10.00.

feed.title: Offshore Lease Sales Net $279M With Chevron, BP, Shell Bids
feed.summary: The Trump administration's initial offshore oil and gas lease sale in the Gulf of Mexico, conducted under a new July tax cut and spending bill, generated $279 million. Major energy companies Chevron, BP, and Shell participated in the bidding process. The article highlights Law360's role in providing fast-moving legal news and analysis to subscribers.

feed.title: T. Rowe Price VP Husain Arif sells $434k in stock
feed.summary: Husain Arif, Vice President at T. Rowe Price Group Inc. (NASDAQ:TROW), sold 4,260 shares of company stock for a total of $434,335 on December 10, 2025. Following this transaction, Arif directly owns over 47,000 shares. This sale comes amidst other company news including asset outflows, an increased price target from TD Cowen, and a strategic reorganization due to the departure of the Chief Operating Officer.

feed.title: Mondelēz International Declares Quarterly Dividend of $0.50 per Share
feed.summary: Mondelēz International declared a quarterly dividend of $0.50 per share of Class A common stock, payable on January 14, 2026, to shareholders of record by December 31, 2025. This dividend highlights the company's financial health, commitment to shareholder returns, and strong market presence with approximately $36.4 billion in net revenues for 2024. The snack food giant, known for brands like Oreo and Cadbury, also maintains its commitment to sustainability as a member of the Dow Jones Best-in-Class indices.

feed.title: Ticketmaster, Live Nation face lawsuit from concertgoers over monopoly and high ticket fees
feed.summary: Millions of Ticketmaster customers are moving towards class certification in a major antitrust lawsuit against Live Nation Entertainment and its Ticketmaster subsidiary. The lawsuit alleges that the company inflates ticket prices and uses its monopoly power to control the live events industry through exclusive contracts, excessive fees, and coercive venue practices. If certified, Live Nation-Ticketmaster could face billions in liabilities and potentially a breakup, leading to lower ticket fees and increased competition.

feed.title: ServiceNow (NOW) Deepens Its Long-Term Commitment to Canada with CA$110 Million Investment; Analysts Remain Bullish
feed.summary: ServiceNow (NYSE: NOW) has pledged a CA$110 million investment to Canada, aiming to accelerate AI adoption in the public sector and establish a new Canada Centre of Excellence, creating approximately 100 high-skilled jobs. This commitment follows ServiceNow's plans to acquire Veza for enhanced identity security and comes as Barclays reiterated a "Buy" rating for ServiceNow with a $1,225 price target. The company continues to unify systems, data, and workflows with its AI-powered platform, demonstrating significant hedge fund interest.

feed.title: AI Hardware Leader Rallies Into Buy Zone As Earnings Approach
feed.summary: Jabil (JBL), an artificial intelligence hardware provider, has entered a buy zone as its stock rallies, setting up for its fiscal first-quarter earnings report next week. The company is poised for its eighth consecutive win on Thursday, thrusting Jabil stock into the spotlight of IBD 50 Growth Stocks To Watch. This positive movement comes amid a strong performance and rising composite rating for Jabil.

feed.title: Cult classic chain praised as 'better than Texas Roadhouse' to open 2 new spots
feed.summary: Olive Garden, a chain praised by some as "better than Texas Roadhouse," is expanding with two new locations: one in Greenville, Texas opening December 15th, and another in Piqua, Ohio opening January 12th, 2026. This expansion comes as parent company Darden Restaurants plans to open 65 new restaurants across its brands between May 2025 and May 2026. Additionally, Olive Garden is bringing back two discontinued menu items, Braised Beef Tortelloni and Ravioli di Portobello, until March 22, 2026.
